00005 #ifndef SCRIPTING_BRIDGE_H_
00006 #define SCRIPTING_BRIDGE_H_
00007 
00008 #include <map>
00009 #include <string>
00010 #include <nacl/nacl_npapi.h>
00011 #include <nacl/nacl_npapi.h>
00012 #include <nacl/npapi_extensions.h>
00013 
00014 namespace bridge {
00015   class ScriptingBridge : public NPObject {
00016    public:
00017     typedef bool (ScriptingBridge::*Method)(const NPVariant* args,
00018                                             uint32_t arg_count,
00019                                             NPVariant* result);
00020 
00021     typedef bool (ScriptingBridge::*Property)( NPVariant* result);
00022     
00023     explicit ScriptingBridge(NPP npp)
00024         : npp_(npp),
00025         scriptable_object_(NULL),
00026         device2d_(NULL),
00027         thread_(0),
00028         window_(NULL)
00029         {
00030           InitializeIdentifiers();
00031         }
00032 
00033     virtual ~ScriptingBridge();
00034 
00035     NPObject* GetScriptableObject();     
00036     NPError SetWindow(NPWindow* window);
00037     
00038     // These methods represent the NPObject implementation.  The browser calls
00039     // these methods by calling functions in the |np_class| struct.
00040     virtual void Invalidate();
00041     bool AddMethod(std::string, Method, NPIdentifier);
00042     void CreateContext();
00043     
00044     virtual bool HasMethod(NPIdentifier name);
00045     virtual bool Invoke(NPIdentifier name,
00046                         const NPVariant* args,
00047                         uint32_t arg_count,
00048                         NPVariant* result);
00049     virtual bool InvokeDefault(const NPVariant* args,
00050                                uint32_t arg_count,
00051                                NPVariant* result);
00052     virtual bool HasProperty(NPIdentifier name);
00053     virtual bool GetProperty(NPIdentifier name, NPVariant* result);
00054     virtual bool SetProperty(NPIdentifier name, const NPVariant* value);
00055     virtual bool RemoveProperty(NPIdentifier name);
00056 
00059     //virtual void DerivedSetup();
00060     
00061     // static bool InitializeIdentifiers();
00062     bool InitializeIdentifiers();
00063 
00064     static NPClass np_class;
00065 
00066     // These methods are exposed via the scripting bridge to the browser.
00067     // Each one is mapped to a string id, which is the name of the method that
00068     // the broswer sees.  For example, Paint() has id 'paint', so in the browser
00069     // JavaScript, you would write tumbler.paint() to invoke the Paint() method
00070     // in this object.
00071     //
00072     // Each of these methods wraps a method in the associated Pepper3D object,
00073     // which is where the actual implementation lies.
00074 
00075     // Draws the quarter-circle image representing the stochasitc PI generator.
00076     bool Paint(const NPVariant* args, uint32_t arg_count, NPVariant* result);
00077 
00078     bool IsContextValid() {
00079       return device2d_ != NULL;
00080     }
00081     
00082    protected:
00083     NPP npp_;
00084     NPObject* window_object_;
00085     NPObject* scriptable_object_;  // strong reference
00086     NPDevice* device2d_;  // The PINPAPI 2D device.
00087     pthread_t thread_;
00088 
00089     NPWindow* window_;    
00090     NPDeviceContext2D context2d_;  // The PINPAPI 2D drawing context.
00091     
00092     static NPIdentifier id_paint;
00093     static std::map<NPIdentifier, Method>* method_table;
00094     static std::map<NPIdentifier, Property>* property_table;
00095   };
00096 
00097 }  // namespace bridge
00098 
00099 #endif  // EXAMPLES_PI_GENERATOR_SCRIPTING_BRIDGE_H_
